ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC APPEND BASE=<libref.>SAS-data-set <DATA=<libref.>SAS-data-set> <FORCE> <APPENDVER=V6> <GETSORT>;
    
The APPEND procedure adds the observations from one SAS data set to the end of another 
SAS data set. 

Generally, the APPEND procedure functions the same as the APPEND statement in the 
DATASETS procedure. The only difference between the APPEND procedure and the APPEND 
statement in PROC DATASETS is the default for libref in the BASE= and DATA= arguments. 
For PROC APPEND, the default is either WORK or USER. For the APPEND statement, the 
default is the libref of the procedure input library.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BASE=<libref.>SAS-data-set] 
      
Names the data set to which you want to add observations.
Specifies a SAS version behavior for appending observations to the BASE= data set.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Uses the Version 6 behavior for appending observations to the BASE= data set, which  is to append one observation at a time.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA=<libref.> SAS-data-set] 
      
Names the SAS data set containing observations that you want to append to the end 
of the SAS data set specified in the BASE= argument.

[Syntax: ENCRYPTKEY=key-value] 
      
Specifies the key value for AES encryption.

Forces the APPEND statement to concatenate data sets when the DATA= data set contains 
variables that either 

o are not in the BASE= data set

o do not have the same type as the variables in the BASE= data set

o are longer than the variables in the BASE= data set.

Copies the sort indicator from the DATA= data set to the BASE= data set. The sort 
indicator is established by either a PROC SORT or an ORDERBY clause in PROC SQL 
if the following criteria are met:

    o The BASE= data set must:
        o be SAS Version 7 or higher
        o contain no observations
        o accept sort indicators
        
    o The DATA= data set must:
        o contain a sort indicator established by PROC SORT
        o be the same data representation as the BASE= data set

Suppresses the warning when used with the FORCE option to concatenate two data sets 
with different variables.
